noun.description: A feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else's possessions, qualities, or luck.
examples: she felt a twinge of envy for the people on board

verb.description: Desire to have a quality, possession, or other desirable attribute belonging to (someone else)
examples: he envied people who did not have to work on weekends

origin: Middle English (also in the sense hostility, enmity): from Old French envie (noun), envier (verb), from Latin invidia, from invidere regard maliciously, grudge, from in- into + videre to see.
